verses.roman:
tāṅhāra ananta guṇa--kahi diṅmātra
ācārya gosāñi yāṅre bhuñjāya śrāddha-pātra

synonyms: tāṅhāra—Haridāsa Ṭhākura's; ananta—unlimited; guṇa—qualities; kahi—I speak; diṅ-mātra—only a small part; ācārya gosāñi—Śrī Advaita Ācārya Prabhu; yāṅre—to whom; bhuñjāya—offered to eat; śrāddha-pātra—prasāda offered to Lord Viṣṇu.
translation: There was no end to the transcendental qualities of Haridāsa Ṭhākura. Here I mention but a fraction of his qualities. He was so exalted that Advaita Gosvāmī, when performing the śrāddha ceremony of his father, offered him the first plate.
